title: What counts as thornmail "mitigated" damage?
body: As we all know, {{champion:201}} and {{item:3075}} work together.  But what else increases damage done by {{item:3075}} ?  Does the rest of your armor, including Guardian/Noble buff?  Does Knight synergy get added?  If I stack 2 {{item:3075}}, do they both do full damage for each other's mitigated damage? (For example, if one {{item:3075}} mitigates 100 damage, do each of them recognize that 200 damage is mitigated and each do 200 damage?)

replies.body:
Yes, they stack.
Mitigated dmg = attacker's dmg - the dmg you actually took
for example a draven crit for 400dmg, you have 200 armor, so you are taking 100/(100+200)=33.33% dmg, approx 120dmg
mitigated dmg(dmg reflected by thornmail) = 400-120 = 280
Shielded damage, Immune to critical hits, Magic damage reduction, Blocked Knight damage.

I believe they stack, given the lack of a 'unique' passive on them. 
I don't know if armor diminishing returns are calculated in the same way in TFT as on SR, but if your given amount of armor produced 50% mitigation, then yeah you should reflect the entire damage of the auto attack back at them if wearing 2 TM's.
And yes, it applies to your total armor, so anything that increases armor also increases the damage reflected back.
